title: A Guide to Your Car's Dashboard Warning Lights
summary: From the check engine light to the TPMS symbol, this guide explains what the most important dashboard warning lights mean and how you should react.
content: Content for A Guide to Your Car's Dashboard Warning Lights goes here. This is an essential reference guide for every driver. It categorizes warning lights by their color code: red for serious issues requiring immediate attention, yellow/orange for cautions that need to be checked soon, and green/blue for informational indicators. The article covers the most critical symbols, including the Oil Pressure warning, Engine Temperature warning, and Airbag fault light, explaining the severity of each and the proper response. By understanding these symbols, drivers can make safer decisions, prevent minor issues from becoming major repairs, and feel more confident and in control behind the wheel.
